description: Recruits the executive team, associates, and consultants
Creates high level goals for the club and its direction
Informs and empowers all members to execute their duties
Manages distribution and execution of responsibilities
Acts as a liaison to CSCE national and regional
Prepares the interim and final CSCE club reports
Ensures sustainability of club and its presidency
Prepares the club transition report for the next year
Manages an undergraduate research opportunity program with civil engineering professors
Increase familiarity and visibility of graduate studies and research to civil engineering at the University of Toronto
Organize an undergraduate and graduate research showcase
Ensure a balanced budget throughout the school year
Develop plans to achieve funding from both internal and external legal sources
Tabulate expenses and revenue as accrued
Conduct monthly financial reviews where revenues, expenses, and overall budgets are presented
Organizes logistics for events and chapter initiatives (e.g. room bookings, catering, audio/visual equipment)
Ensures that chapter events are planned in a timely manner and do not conflict with academic schedules of all years of Civil Engineering students
Manages club assets and rentals (lockers, temporary office spaces, club merchandise)
Supports President with event planning and other operational tasks
Work alongside the President(s) to organize a plan for the school year to reach certain milestones for each facet of civil engineering
Work alongside the External parties to create events that best serve students’ professional development needs
Foster and maintain a relationship between civil engineering alumni and current students
Manage a mentorship program with current undergraduate students with civil engineering alumni
Support the VP Professional Development with organizing the mentorship program with current undergraduate students with civil engineering alumni
Oversees all marketing operations of the chapter (eg. Event Promotion, Facebook, Instagram, Website)
Ensures all marketing materials and events (posters, online banners, class announcements, alerts, etc.) are released in a timely manner
Develops and implements a marketing strategy to increase communication and involvement between CSCE and the student body
Manage and maintain the chapter website including current and archived events, chapter sponsors, etc.
Assist the VP Marketing in overseeing all marketing operations of the chapter (eg. Event Promotion, facebook page, instagram page, and other socials as deemed fit)
Utilize a marketing strategy to increase communication between CSCE and the student body
Create graphics and content in alignment with the marketing strategy for upcoming events and initiatives
Maintain and update the chapter website in alignment with marketing strategy and chapter initiatives

Promote upcoming events and initiatives through means of online and  in-person channels, including but not limited to hanging up flyers on display boards, making class announcements, speaking at events etc
Shall be the single point of contact between the club and external organizations/companies
Seek sponsors for events
Reach out to other clubs and groups for collaboration(s) and promotion(s) opportunities for the CSCE UofT Chapter
Research goodwill opportunities for chapter outreach to external communities
Organize fundraising events among the student body
Generates year-long student initiatives to increase community engagement
Assist VP Community in researching goodwill opportunities for chapter outreach to external communities
Assist VP Community in organizing fundraising events among the student body
Support the VP Community by organizing civil-based charity and goodwill events to generate year-long student initiatives to increase community engagement
Support the VP Academia by organizing events to raise awareness of research and educational opportunities available to students
Assist with marketing events to first years
Provide a first year perspective on professional development needs
Assist with event planning according to member’s area of interest
